intro: Narcissus × koshinomurae nothosubsp. koshinomurae, commonly known as the Koshinomura narcissus, is a hybrid plant resulting from crosses between different narcissus species. It is characterized by its striking white flowers with a yellow corona, typical of many daffodil varieties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, strap-like leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in temperate climates. This nothosubspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
